title: 10 K-beauty moisturisers that are available to shop in India right now | Vogue India
text: To revisit this article, visit My Profile, then View saved stories To revisit this article, visit My Profile, then View saved stories By Priyanka Ghura Kuka K-beauty products tend to focus on skin health and hydration, which is why those obsessed with Korean skincare know that layering on humectants, occlusives and emollients is key to delivering plumper, younger-looking skin with a lit-from-within glow. If your goals align, you'll want a lightweight moisturiser that is chock-full of soothing and protective ingredients that'll respect the natural skin barrier—another prerequisite of K-beauty products. We list out the best Korean imports available in India that you can add to cart. Have skin that feels dry, parched and flaky in the AM? This moisturiser is formulated with green tea seed oil from the island of Jeju, which has a water-retaining effect for the skin. Packed with amino acids and antioxidants, it helps boost skin's hydration and shield it from environmental stressors. By Hasina Jeelani By Prabal Sharma By Kejhal Kalra If you can’t stand an oil slick on your face after moisturising, this is the formula for you. It’s perfect for hydrating oily skin and keeps the shine away by maintaining the skin’s oil and moisture balance. Thanks to plant-based extracts and a low-irritant formula, it’s great for soothing and calming even the most sensitive skin. This gel-cream is formulated to deliver lightweight hydrating ingredients like squalane, glycerin and ceramides to the skin, bolstering the natural skin barrier and helping it retain water. The formula is also heavy on the skin-soothers, so any redness or irritated will be nixed on usage. By Hasina Jeelani By Prabal Sharma By Kejhal Kalra Calendula oil has anti-fungal, anti-inflammatory, and antibacterial properties that might make it useful in healing wounds and soothing eczema, making it the perfect addition to a moisturiser for dry, redness-prone skin. It works for all skin types as it regulates oil secretion for those with oily skin too. Laneige is literally named after the French word ‘la neige” which means ‘the snow’ thanks to its advanced water science technology, so hydration is practically a guarantee with their cult products. This almost water-like cream may feel heavy at first but penetrates fast, so skin will drink it up instantly without leaving any greasy residue behind. By Hasina Jeelani By Prabal Sharma By Kejhal Kalra If its glass skin you’re after, this is the cream that can get you as close to it as possible. Thanks to small particles of collagen and baobab water, it’ll leave your skin firm, bouncy and youthful. It has a light gel-like texture, so even those with oily or combination skin will enjoy using it. K-beauty products are famed for their usage of less-than-conventional ingredients, with snail mucin and bee venom being at the top of the list. Steam creams are blended using high temperatures and steam technology, which increases the efficacy of the product, so collagen-boosting bee venom and hydrating snail mucin can get where they need to go, ASAP. The ultra-light texture means that it is perfect for those with oily or acne-prone skin. By Hasina Jeelani By Prabal Sharma By Kejhal Kalra Pumped up with centella asiatica extract (also known as gotu kola), this cream soothes and relieves irritated skin thanks to the inclusion of asiaticoside and ceramides, which strengthen the skin barrier by preventing the evaporation of moisture inside the skin. This hypoallergenic, lightweight moisturiser with birch sap is great for oily and acne-prone skin since it won’t clog up pores. Whatever your skin type, you’re sure to love the satin finish and the wearable texture. This ultra-luxe anti-ageing potion combines extracts of Korean red ginseng and retinol to replenish moisture while keeping fine lines and wrinkles at bay. You'll love the silky-smooth texture of the cream as well as how effectively it fights signs of ageing while giving a serious a boost of moisture to the complexion. Would you use real snail slime on your face if it gave you glowing skin?
